contentrichtext.text: {{spanish name 2|Quintana|Rivalta}} {{MedalTop}} {{MedalCountry|{{CUB}}}} {{MedalSport | Men's [[Wrestling at the Summer Olympics|wrestling]]}} {{MedalGold | [[Wrestling at the 2004 Summer Olympics|2004 Athens]] | [[Wrestling at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Men's freestyle 60 kg|Freestyle 60 kg]]}} {{MedalBottom}} '''Yandro Miguel Quintana Rivalta''' (born January 30, 1980 in [[Ciego de Ávila]]) is a [[Cuba]]n [[Sport wrestling|wrestler]] who competed in the [[Wrestling at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Men's freestyle 60 kg|Men's Freestyle 60 kg]] at the [[2004 Summer Olympics]] which were also his first Olympics. He won the gold medal by defeating Masuod Jokar in the final with the help of his coach Filberto Delgado. He stands 5'2 and 132 lbs. In 2003 he came in first at the Pan American Games. He now resides in [[Havana]], Cuba. ==References== *[http://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/qu/yandro-miguel-quintana-1.html sports-reference] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Quintana, Yandro | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =Olympic wrestler | DATE OF BIRTH = January 30, 1980 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Quintana, Yandro}} [[Category:1980 births]] [[Category:Cuban sport wrestlers]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Wrestlers at the 2004 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Wrestlers at the 2007 Pan American Games]] [[Category:Wrestlers at the 2008 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Olympic wrestlers of Cuba]] [[Category:Olympic gold medalists for Cuba]] [[Category:Olympic medalists in wrestling]] [[Category:Medalists at the 2004 Summer Olympics]] {{Wrestling-bio-stub}} {{Cuba-Olympic-medalist-stub}}
